intro: Hieracium heldreichii subsp. barbatiforme, commonly known as the Barbatiform Hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
